chargeHist.descr: Chronic Neglect of a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Anne Marie Roelke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Chronic Neglect of a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.215(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full from bond posted.

Absolute sobriety. No alcohol. No drugs. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. Random testing. AODA and follow up deemed appropriate. Follow CPS orders. Contact with child per CPS orders. Submit to DNA analysis. If Agent deems probationary needs have been met can petition the Court for early termination.
